title: How much does social media reflect the society? - Quora

response.answer_text: I have a completely unsubstantiated theory that social media attracts very specific personality types to post: lonely, reactive, impulsive, and narcisstic. And that the vast majority of active commenters on social media have one or more of these traits. And therefore a small percentage of specific personalities dominate the content, and do not represent the average or median zeitgeist.
It depends on type of society. You can not compare USA - Russia - China - India - Middle East etc. If we speak about Western World it reflects 95%.
